us.pecon.ray.chessPlay

Class ChessBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.pecon.ray.chessPlay.ChessBoard
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChessBoard_ai

    public class ChessBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a chess board in which individual pieces will be placed and manipulated upon. Its primary method of manipulation and containment is a matrix array containing individual Piece classes, which can be moved around with either human readable or machine friendly commands.
    Author:
    Ethan Arns

      • ChessBoard

        public ChessBoard()
        Chess board class constructor. Sets current turn to white and initiates the two other variables blank

    • Method Detail

      • setDebug

        public void setDebug(boolean which)
        Sets debug mode. If on, System will print messages showing moves, errors, and board states.
        Parameters:
        which - true to set debug mode on, false to disable debug mode

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()
        Getter for debug mode.
        Returns:
        true if debug mode is on

        Returns the current turn as a String
        Returns:
        a string representing the turn

      • changeTurn

        public void changeTurn()
        Changes the turn to the opposite of what it currently is. If turn is invalid, it set it to White.

      • getPieceRelative

        protected Piece getPieceRelative(Piece p,
                                 int x,
                                 int y)
        Returns a piece relative to the piece in question by obtaining the location coordinates of the piece itself and then checking the offset set in the x and y coordinate parameters
        Parameters:
        p - the initial piece to check from
        x - the up and down movement
        y - the left and right movement
        Returns:
        piece found at location, null if invalid

      • getPieceRelative

        protected Piece getPieceRelative(Position pos,
                                 int x,
                                 int y)
        Returns a piece relative to the location specified, located by checking the position offset by the x and y coordinate parameters
        Parameters:
        pos - the initial piece's position to check from
        x - the up and down movement
        y - the left and right movement
        Returns:
        piece found at location, null if invalid

      • move

        public boolean move(Piece p,
                    int x,
                    int y)
        Moves a piece by advancing it according to the offset specified by x and y parameters. Also determines capture. Returns true if successful.
        Parameters:
        p - the piece selected to be moved
        x - how far left or right to move
        y - how far up or down to move
        Returns:
        true if move was successful, false if not

      • moveTo

        public boolean moveTo(Piece p,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Attempts to move a piece to the set parameters. Also determines capture. Returns true if successful.
        Parameters:
        p - the piece selected to be moved
        x - x position to attempt to move to
        y - y position to attempt to move to
        Returns:
        true if move was successful, false if not

      • moveCheckAssigner

        protected boolean moveCheckAssigner(Piece p,
                                    int relX,
                                    int relY)
        A small method that finds what type of piece is being checked for movement, then assigns and hands off the correct method to them
        Parameters:
        p - input piece that is being checked for relative movement
        relX - relative x movement
        relY - relative y movement
        Returns:
        true if valid move

      • straightRecursive

        protected Position straightRecursive(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     char dir,
                                     Piece initPiece,
                                     Position newPos)
        Returns farthest acceptable placement away from the set position straight up, left, right, or downwards ('u','l','r','d')
        Parameters:
        x - x position of the checked position
        y - y position of the checked position
        dir - character representing up, down, left, or right
        initPiece - initial piece being checked, doesn't change, just used
        newPos - the new Position
        Returns:
        the position of either end of check or right place

      • diagonalRecursive

        protected Position diagonalRecursive(int x,
                                     int y,
                                     java.lang.String dir,
                                     Piece initPiece,
                                     Position newPos)
        Returns farthest acceptable diagonal placement, using multiple recursive functions.
        Parameters:
        x - x position of the checked position
        y - y position of the checked position
        dir - diagonal directions as strings
        initPiece - initial piece being checked, doesn't change, just used
        newPos - the new Position
        Returns:
        the position of either end of check or right place

      • moveCheck_pawn

        protected boolean moveCheck_pawn(Piece p,
                                 int relX,
                                 int relY)
        Checking movement validity for pawns. Done in ChessBoard class due to difficulties with checking board states in subclasses
        Parameters:
        p - the piece being checked
        relX - the relative x movement
        relY - the relative y movement
        Returns:
        true if move is okay

      • moveCheck_rook

        protected boolean moveCheck_rook(Piece p,
                                 int relX,
                                 int relY)
        A general method for checking if a rook's new position works. Sends off p in differing directions, checking either if the correct position is on a blank or on the first enemy piece
        Parameters:
        p - piece selected to be moved
        relX - relative x position
        relY - relative y position
        Returns:
        true if move is okay

      • moveCheck_bishop

        protected boolean moveCheck_bishop(Piece p,
                                   int relX,
                                   int relY)
        Checks in all 4 diagonal directions to see if move is legal
        Parameters:
        p - piece selected to be moved
        relX - relative x position
        relY - relative y position
        Returns:
        true if move is okay

      • moveCheck_king

        protected boolean moveCheck_king(Piece p,
                                 int relX,
                                 int relY)
        A checker for King movement. Checks the surrounding board according to legal moves, and returns true if it finds it.
        Parameters:
        p - piece selected to be moved
        relX - relative x position
        relY - relative y position
        Returns:
        true if move is legal

      • moveCheck_queen

        protected boolean moveCheck_queen(Piece p,
                                  int relX,
                                  int relY)
        A checker for Queen movement. Checks the surrounding board according to legal moves, and returns true if it finds it.
        Parameters:
        p - piece selected to be moved
        relX - relative x position
        relY - relative y position
        Returns:
        true if move legal

      • moveCheck_knight

        protected boolean moveCheck_knight(Piece p,
                                   int relX,
                                   int relY)
        A checker for Knight movement. Checks the surrounding board according to legal moves, and returns true if it finds it.
        Parameters:
        p - selected Piece
        relX - relative x position to check
        relY - relative y position to check
        Returns:
        true if can move, false if not
